page.title: 09THE HOSPITAL,WITHERNSEA
page.content: The two storey hospital,often referred to locally as 'the con home', is undergoing modernisation.It has 8 wards made up of 32 beds,10 male and 22 female.It has 40 nursing staff, 7 catering staff,3 porters,6 doctors and 2 administrators.On the ground floor there is an emergency casualty area and the hospital can perform minor operations. The hospital is a branch of Princess Royal in Hull and more serious cases are transferred to Hull.Attached are a district nurse, nurse and a clinic.A visiting consultant,psychiatric care, occupational therapy and chiropody are also provided.Food is prepared on the premises but laundry is sent to Hull. The building was first opened in 1854 as the station hotel but in 1892 was bought by the Reckitts and handed over to HRI for use as a convalescent home.
